p: Statistical analyses were conducted using R, an open-source software environment (R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria) [ 23]. Means and proportions were calculated for participant characteristics and variables of interest. The number of respondents for each question (rather than the full dataset) was used as the denominator for calculating item proportions. Odds ratios (ORs) were used to compare results between transgender women and cis-MSM using univariate logistic regression with a random intercept to account for clustering by site.
